Package core

Interface HlaPayloadManager

  • public interface HlaPayloadManager
    Manager used to manage HlaPayloads.

    This class is ThreadSafe as defined by Java Concurrency in Practice, see jcip.net.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getHlaPayloads

        java.util.List<HlaPayload> getHlaPayloads()
        Gets a list of all HlaPayloads within interest, both local and remote. The list is a copy that is allowed to be altered.
        Returns:
        a list of HlaPayloads

      • getAllHlaPayloads

        java.util.List<HlaPayload> getAllHlaPayloads()
        Gets a list of all HlaPayloads, both local and remote. HlaPayloads not within interest are also included. The list is a copy that is allowed to be altered.
        Returns:
        a list of all HlaPayloads

      • getLocalHlaPayloads

        java.util.List<HlaPayload> getLocalHlaPayloads()
        Gets a list of local HlaPayloads within interest. The list is a copy that is allowed to be altered.
        Returns:
        a list of local HlaPayloads

      • getRemoteHlaPayloads

        java.util.List<HlaPayload> getRemoteHlaPayloads()
        Gets a list of remote HlaPayloads within interest. The list is a copy that is allowed to be altered.
        Returns:
        a list of remote HlaPayloads

      • getPayloadByHlaInstanceName

        HlaPayload getPayloadByHlaInstanceName​(java.lang.String hlaInstanceName)
        Find a HlaPayload with the given HLA instance name. If none is found, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        hlaInstanceName - the HLA instance name of the HlaPayload to find
        Returns:
        the specified HlaPayload, or null if not found.

      • getPayloadByHlaInstanceHandle

        HlaPayload getPayloadByHlaInstanceHandle​(byte[] encodedHlaInstanceHandle)
        Find a HlaPayload with the given HLA instance name. If none is found, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        encodedHlaInstanceHandle - the encoded HLA instance handle of the HlaPayload to find
        Returns:
        the specified HlaPayload, or null if not found.

      • createLocalHlaPayload

        HlaPayload createLocalHlaPayload()
                          throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                                 HlaInternalException,
                                 HlaRtiException,
                                 HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                 HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Creates a new HlaPayload, and sets all Create attributes.
        Returns:
        Returns a new local HlaPayload.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • createLocalHlaPayload

        HlaPayload createLocalHlaPayload​(java.lang.String hlaInstanceName)
                          throws HlaIllegalInstanceNameException,
                                 HlaInstanceNameInUseException,
                                 HlaNotConnectedException,
                                 HlaInternalException,
                                 HlaRtiException,
                                 HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                 HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Creates a new HlaPayload with a specified HLA instance name, and sets all Create attributes.
        Parameters:
        hlaInstanceName - the HLA instance name to register for this instance
        Returns:
        Returns a new local HlaPayload.
        Throws:
        HlaIllegalInstanceNameException - if the name is illegal
        HlaInstanceNameInUseException - if the name is already in use
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • deleteLocalHlaPayload

        HlaPayload deleteLocalHlaPayload​(HlaPayload payload)
                          throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                                 HlaInternalException,
                                 HlaRtiException,
                                 HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                 HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Deletes a local HlaPayload and removes it from the federation.
        Parameters:
        payload - The HlaPayload to delete
        Returns:
        the HlaPayload deleted, null if it did not exist.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • deleteLocalHlaPayload

        HlaPayload deleteLocalHlaPayload​(HlaPayload payload,
                                 HlaTimeStamp timestamp)
                          throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                                 HlaInternalException,
                                 HlaRtiException,
                                 HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                 HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Deletes a local HlaPayload and removes it from the federation with a specified timestamp
        Parameters:
        payload - The HlaPayload to delete
        timestamp - timestamp when the instance was removed.
        Returns:
        the HlaPayload deleted, null if it did not exist.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • deleteLocalHlaPayload

        HlaPayload deleteLocalHlaPayload​(HlaPayload payload,
                                 HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
                          throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                                 HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                                 HlaInternalException,
                                 HlaRtiException,
                                 HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                 HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Deletes a local HlaPayload and removes it from the federation at a specified logical time.
        Parameters:
        payload - The HlaPayload to delete
        logicalTime - The logical time when the instance was removed.
        Returns:
        the HlaPayload deleted, null if it did not exist.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if the logical time is invalid
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • deleteLocalHlaPayload

        HlaPayload deleteLocalHlaPayload​(HlaPayload payload,
                                 HlaTimeStamp timestamp,
                                 HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
                          throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                                 HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                                 HlaInternalException,
                                 HlaRtiException,
                                 HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                 HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Deletes a local HlaPayload and removes it from the federation with a specified timestamp at a specified logical time.
        Parameters:
        payload - The HlaPayload to delete
        timestamp - timestamp when the instance was removed.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the instance was removed.
        Returns:
        the HlaPayload deleted, null if it did not exist.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if the logical time is invalid
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • addHlaPayloadManagerListener

        void addHlaPayloadManagerListener​(HlaPayloadManagerListener managerListener)
        Add an HlaPayload manager listener.
        Parameters:
        managerListener - listener to add

      • removeHlaPayloadManagerListener

        void removeHlaPayloadManagerListener​(HlaPayloadManagerListener managerListener)
        Remove an HlaPayload manager listener.
        Parameters:
        managerListener - listener to remove

      • addHlaPayloadDefaultInstanceListener

        void addHlaPayloadDefaultInstanceListener​(HlaPayloadListener listener)
        Add a listener that will automatically be added to all instances of HlaPayload (Both local and remote). The listener is notified when any attribute of an instance of HlaPayload is updated. The listener is also called when an interaction is sent to an instance of HlaPayload. All listeners will automatically be removed when an instance is removed. This method is idempotent.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to add.

      • removeHlaPayloadDefaultInstanceListener

        void removeHlaPayloadDefaultInstanceListener​(HlaPayloadListener listener)
        Remove a listener from the set of listeners that are automatically added to new instances of HlaPayload. Note: The listener will not be removed from already existing instances of HlaPayload. This method is idempotent.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove.

      • addHlaPayloadDefaultInstanceValueListener

        void addHlaPayloadDefaultInstanceValueListener​(HlaPayloadValueListener valueListener)
        Add a valueListener that will automatically be added to all instances of HlaPayload (Both local and remote). The Valuelistener is notified when any attribute of an instance of HlaPayload is updated. Note that the attribute values that are notified are not guaranteed to be the latest available values for that attribute. All listeners will automatically be removed when an instance is removed. This method is idempotent.
        Parameters:
        valueListener - The valueListener to add.

      • removeHlaPayloadDefaultInstanceValueListener

        void removeHlaPayloadDefaultInstanceValueListener​(HlaPayloadValueListener valueListener)
        Remove a valueListener from the set of listeners that are automatically added to new instances of HlaPayload. Note: The valueListener will not be removed from already existing instances of HlaPayload. This method is idempotent.
        Parameters:
        valueListener - The valueListener to remove.

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled​(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables the HlaPayload manager. The manager is enabled by default. The state can only be changed when not connected. When the HlaPayload manager is disabled it will act as disconnected, ie throws HlaNotConnectedException.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable the HlaPayload manager, otherwise false

      • setEnabledIfAvailableInFom

        void setEnabledIfAvailableInFom()
        Enables the HlaPayload manager if it is available in the FOM at runtime. The manager is enabled by default. The state can only be changed when not connected. When the HlaPayload manager is disabled it will act as disconnected, ie throws HlaNotConnectedException.

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Check if the HlaPayload manager is actually enabled when connected. An HlaPayload manager may be disabled with the setEnabled(false) function, or it may be configured as if available in the FOM by the setEnabledIfAvailableInFom() function and then not available in the FOM at runtime.

        This method should only be used when connected, it will always return false when not connected.

        Returns:
        true if connected and the HlaPayload manager is enabled.
